adjective.description: Having or involving a sensation of spinning around and losing one's balance.
examples: Jonathan had begun to suffer dizzy spells
he looked around, dizzy with happiness

verb.description: Make (someone) feel unsteady, confused, or amazed.

origin: Old English dysig foolish, of West Germanic origin; related to Low German dusig, dösig giddy and Old High German tusic foolish, weak.
